freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.filter_page_if(condition: Callable[[Element], bool]) → Callable

Decorator factory for conditionally applying a PDF filter based on a predicate.

Creates a decorator that will only execute the wrapped PDF filter function if the specified condition evaluates to True for the given XML root element.

Parameters:

condition (Callable[[etree.Element], bool]) – A function that takes an XML element and returns True if the filter should be applied

Returns:

A decorator that can be applied to PDF filter functions

Return type:

Callable

Notes

The decorated PDF filter function must accept an XML root element and return a list of PdfBlocks

freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.get_lines_with_font(blk: Element, font: str) → List[Element]

Return all the line with a certain font in a tree

Parameters:

  • blk (etree.Element) – tree from which extract lines

  • font (str) – font to extract

Returns:

list of relevant blocks

Return type:

List[etree.Element]

freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.is_contained(blk: Element, x_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None, y_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → bool

Check if a block’s bounding box is fully contained within specified ranges.

Parameters:

  • blk (etree.Element) – XML element representing a PDF block

  • x_range (Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional) – Horizontal range (min_x, max_x)

  • y_range (Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional) – Vertical range (min_y, max_y)

Returns:

True if entire bbox is within ranges, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.is_positioned(blk: Element, x_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None, y_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → bool

Check if a block is positioned within specified x and/or y ranges. :param blk: XML element representing a PDF block :type blk: etree.Element :param x_range: Minimum and maximum x-coordinate values (left, right) :type x_range: Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional :param y_range: Minimum and maximum y-coordinate values (bottom, top) :type y_range: Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional

Returns:

True if block’s coordinates are within specified ranges, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.is_present_contained(blk: Element, text: str, x_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None, y_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → bool

Check if text is present in a block fully contained within specified ranges.

Parameters:

  • blk (etree.Element) – XML element representing a PDF block

  • text (str) – Text to search for

  • x_range (Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional) – Horizontal range (min_x, max_x)

  • y_range (Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional) – Vertical range (min_y, max_y)

Returns:

True if text is found in block fully contained within ranges, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.is_present_positioned(blk: Element, text: str, x_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None, y_range: Tuple[float, float] | None = None) → bool

Check if text is present in a block within specified coordinate ranges. :param blk: XML element representing a PDF block :type blk: etree.Element :param text: Text to search for :type text: str :param x_range: Horizontal range (left, right) :type x_range: Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional :param y_range: Vertical range (bottom, top) :type y_range: Optional[Tuple[float, float]], optional

Returns:

True if text is found in block within ranges, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.is_present_txt_font(blk: Element, txt: str, font: str) → bool

  • txt (str) – text to search

  • font (str) – font to search

class freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.one_PdfBlockType(*values)

Enum representing one type of pdf blocks in document processing.

RELEVANT_BLOCK

Pdf block with relevant information to extract.

Type:

enum

freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.one_pdf_blk(_: Enum) → one_PdfBlockType

Decorator for overwriting classes definition with a unique pdf block type. It is helpful when there is only one type of pdf block

Returns:

The text block type enum.

Return type:

one_PdfBlockType

freeports_analysis.formats.utils_pdf_filter.standard_header_font_filter(header_txt: str, header_font: str, body_font: str)

Decorator factory for creating PDF filters that process pages with specific header and body fonts.

Creates a filter that: 1. Only processes pages containing the specified header text in the specified header font 2. Extracts all lines with the specified body font as relevant blocks 3. Allows customization of page metadata and block types through decorated functions

Parameters:

  • header_txt (str) – Text that must be present in header to process the page

  • header_font (str) – Font name that header text must use

  • body_font (str) – Font name for lines to extract as relevant blocks

Returns:

Decorator that can be applied to PDF filter functions

Return type:

function

Notes

The decorated function can override: - page_metadata(): returns additional metadata dictionary for each page
